about.title: About Me
about.intro: I’m Deante Mirijello, a Computer Science student in Montreal who enjoys building full-stack software that solves real, practical problems. I like working across the stack—from backend APIs and data modeling to clean, accessible frontend interfaces—and I’m always trying to improve both code quality and user experience. I value teamwork, clear communication, and writing maintainable software that can grow over time. In the future, I’m looking for opportunities where I can keep learning from experienced developers, contribute to real production projects, and evolve into a strong software engineer focused on building reliable applications that people actually use.
about.school.li1: Developing strong foundations in software design, object-oriented programming, and data structures.
about.school.li2: Building team projects using Agile/Scrum, Git workflows, and API-first development.
about.school.li3: Applying classroom concepts to full-stack projects and practical problem solving.
projects.title: Projects
projects.subtitle: Some projects I’ve worked on during school and team projects.
projects.dm.title: DM Creations
projects.dm.desc: Party decoration e-commerce web app for a real client. Built in a team of 5 using Scrum/Agile. Designed C4 architecture and implemented REST APIs.
projects.pet.title: Champlain Pet Clinic
projects.pet.desc: Full-stack pet clinic simulation with 44 students across microservices. I worked on bill-related services and UI improvements.
projects.iot.title: IoT Home Automation & Security
projects.iot.desc: Raspberry Pi smart-home system. Built a Flask + Chart.js dashboard for live monitoring, device control, and historical graphs. Added cloud sync + caching.
projects.bowling.title: Bowling Alley Microservices System
projects.bowling.desc: Distributed system to manage rented shoes, bowling balls, and lanes through an API Gateway.
